First, let's fill in $\purpleD{3}\blueE{2}\maroonD2$ on the place value chart.

Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\purpleD{3}$ | $\blueE2$ | $\maroonD2$

$\begin{align}
\purpleD{3}\text{ hundreds} &=\purpleD{300} \\\\
\blueE{2}\text{ tens}&=\blueE{20} \\\\
 \maroonD2\text{ ones}&=\maroonD2
\end{align}$

$322=\purpleD{3}\text{ hundreds} + \blueE{2}
\text{ tens} + \maroonD{2}\text{ ones}$

Now, let's say the number $\purpleD3\blueE2\maroonD2$ out loud and write it in written form.

$\purpleD{\text{three hundred}}\blueE{\text{ twenty-}}\maroonD{\text{two}}$

The following are equivalent to $322$:  

-  Three hundred twenty-two

-  $3$ hundreds $+\,2$ tens $+\,2$ ones
